title: (x) Bold slab serif face used for CNN Money logo - similar to Stymie {Mike Y}
content:
Wondering what the slab serif face that is used for the word "money"

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013174622im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cnn_money_0436_4108.png)

Thanks!
author: evanmacdonald

comments.content:
You can approximate this probably custom lettering with [Stymie](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013174622/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/stymie/). The Black weight is closest except for the y. Oddly, the Black y is different from the other weights. I think if you added stroke to the Bold weight you would be able to fake it. The M is also a bit different, crotch-wise, but you could edit it or ignore the difference.

- Mike Yanega

I think you're right. That is pretty close. I modified some rockwell (made a new "e," shortened the serifs, tweaked some other points) and got it close enough.

Thanks

[evan](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013174622/http:/www.evanmade.com/)
